article.headline: Lamar 99, Cent. Arkansas 75
article.story: CONWAY, Ark. -- Devon Lamb's double-double led Lamar to a 99-75 victory over Central Arkansas in a Southland Conference opener Saturday. Lamb scored 23 points on 10-for-15 shooting and grabbed 13 rebounds to lead the Cardinals (7-7). Mike James, coming off a school-record 52-point performance Tuesday night against Division III Louisiana College, scored 22 points, including 3 of 5 from 3-point range. Charlie Harper scored 12, Anthony Miles 11 and Coy Custer added 10. Miles also had eight assists. Imad Qahwash paced the Bears (4-10) with 19 points. Dewan Clayborn and Mike Pouncy scored 13 apiece, and Mark Rutledge had 11. Lamar, which is 7-0 against Central Arkansas, held a 51-25 rebounding advantage. With Lamar trailing 10-9, James hit back-to-back 3-pointers and then a jumper to give Lamar a 17-9 edge. Central Arkansas never led after that.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
